moves.1. d4 e6 2. e4 e5: Queen's pawn opening.  This move is very unusual--d5 is the overwhelmingly most popular response.
moves.3. d5: Not in the database.  But it is how I would have responded as white.
moves.3... Bc5 4. Nc3 Bb4: Black has moved two pieces two times.
moves.5. Bd2 Qf6 6. Qf3 d6 7. O-O-O Nh6 8. Bxh: QxBh6+ would also have been interesting.
Seems like black is tossing his pawn advantage.  But those doubled pawns are not worth a whole lot.
moves.28. Nxa5 Rab8 29. Nc6 Rb6 30. Nxa7: While anything but obvious now, white will come to regret snatching that pawn.
moves.30... Ra8 31. Nc6 Rba6 32. c4: This was probably a blunder.  The white king can get pushed back, and white risks losing Rf2 as a consequence.
moves.32... Ra6a3+ 33. Kc2 Ra3xa2+ 34. Kd3: A definite blunder.  Black brilliantly goes for the white king's throat instead of snatching the free rook.
